misdeed: Men in a remote village are being struck by a mysterious ailment, leaving them weak, breathless, and prone to horrific nightmares. Some have even died in their sleep, their faces contorted in terror.
solution: The Vaesen is a Mare and can be defeated by someone loudly declaring her a Mare at the moment she transforms back into a human.

clues.description: The victims all describe the same dream: a shadowy figure with long, dark hair sitting on their chest, stealing their breath.
The afflicted men are often found drenched in sweat, their sheets in disarray, as if they struggled violently in their sleep.
Local folklore whispers of a creature that preys on men at night, feeding on their life force while they sleep.
A strange, oily residue is found on the victims' chests, smelling faintly of wildflowers and decay.
The attacks seem to coincide with the full moon, suggesting a connection to the lunar cycle.
Horses in the village stables are found sweating and agitated in the mornings, their manes tangled and knotted.

plotTwist.description: The village midwife, heartbroken after the death of her own child, is unknowingly afflicted by the Vaesen and seeks solace in the company of the men she visits.
